rooms.name: Well Worn Path
rooms.description: The center of the path is well worn, despite the fact that the forest seems to be creeping in at the edges.  The dark trees loom overhead, diminishing the amount of light that filters down.  To the north, the path disappears gradually as it leads into the forest.  To the south, you can see a large stone wall and a set of wooden doors, with just a roof showing above the wall.

rooms.name: Stone Wall Entrance
rooms.description: The path opens into a clearing before the massive stone wall.  The forest has been cleared out quite a distance away from the wall, allowing for protection from the evils that lurk in the woods.  You can follow the stone wall to the west and to the east, around the outside of the encampment.  There are enormous wooden doors to the south, which stand fifteen feet tall, blocking entrance into the haven.

South.description: There is a set of enormous wooden doors, banded together with thick steel and inlayed with gold.

rooms.name: Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: You stand between the stone wall and the forest.  The clearing looks to be worn down from the constant foot traffic of the guards.  The stone wall is covered with moss and is built so smooth that scaling it is impossible.  A large stone in the wall has been cleared of moss and has been burnt lightly. You can travel along the wall to the west or to the east.

extras.text: &1Rydack 2007&0
As you examine the stone wall closer, you see a name burnt into one of the large stones.

rooms.name: Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The wall bends gracefully to the south, maintaining about the same amount of clearing from the forest.  From here you notice that some sections of the stone in the wall look different from the others, as if a prolonged amount of time passed between the building of each section.  The wall continues to the west and to the south.

rooms.name: Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The wall has been severely damaged here from a past assault.  Some on the stones have been broken and their remnants lay of the ground, scattered and trampled into it.  Even though it has been damaged, the sheer size of the wall still provides remarkable protection for the inhabitants on the other side. The wall continues to the north and to the south.

rooms.name: Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The clearing between the stone wall and the forest seems to have grown smaller, yet still offers a sufficient buffer to ward off attackers seeking to vault the wall from the trees.  There seems to be something unusual about the ground in one area of the clearing, as if it has been traveled more frequently. The wall continues to the north and to the south.

Down.description: The ground is layered with some loose dirt and stone, and a small patch of grass grows sparsely on one small section.

rooms.name: End of Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The clearing comes to an end here.  There is a small wooden bench alongside the stone wall to the west that serves as a resting point for the constantly walking guards.  To the south there is a deep trench that has been dug beside the wall, preventing safe passage further along the stone wall towards the rear of the settlement.  You can travel north into the clearing or you can attempt to climb down into the trench.

extras.text: The small wooden bench is well worn from years of use from the HolyGuards and looks as if it might collapse at any time.

rooms.name: Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The clearing here has been well worn by the foot travel of the guards.  The massive stone wall to the south shows scores of scars and damage, from years of fending off evil attackers attempting to gain entry into the settlement.  The forest is to the north, but the dense growth of pine trees restricts access. The clearing continues along the stone wall to the west and to the east.

rooms.name: Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The stone wall makes a bend towards the south, following the boarder of the settlement.  You can just about make out the sound of townspeople coming from over the wall, but the size of the wall and the noise from the forest drowns it out.  The clearing follows alongside the stone wall, keeping a safe distance from the darkness of the forest to the north and the west.  You can travel east into the clearing towards the main entrance doors of the wall or follow the clearing to the south.

rooms.name: Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The clearing opens up significantly as the stone wall makes a sharp turn to the west, creating somewhat of a courtyard between each section of wall.  The forest is quite a distance away to the northwest, giving the guards ample room to gather for training sessions outside the city wall.  There are several small barriers of stone spread throughout this area giving added protection to the guards from an assault approaching from the forest.  The clearing continues to the north and to the west.

extras.text: These barriers stand about five feet tall, giving just enough space for two guards to take cover behind.  The barriers show signs of wear as if they have been through many fierce battles.

rooms.name: End of Clearing Along the Stone Wall
rooms.description: The clearing alongside of the wall comes to an end at a deep trench that has been dug next to the stone wall.  The trench seems to have been created to aid in the defense of the wall.  The dense forest prevents travel to the north and west of the clearing and the trench blocks passage to the south, creating a dead end.  You can make your way to the east along the clearing.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You stand in the entrance of the courtyard, with the sounds of the townspeople and their movements raising your attention.  The ground is covered with a lush green grass that is keep in immaculate condition despite the constant wear from wandering feet.  From inside the large stone wall only a few treetops can be seen, lending to the protected feeling of being separated from the dreaded forest.  To the south you can see a large mansion with a smaller building beside it.  You can make your way north through the wall doors or into the courtyard to the east, west or south.

North.description: There is a set of enormous doors, banded together with thick steel and inlayed with gold.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: This section of the courtyard has several small granite benches set up, so the townspeople can rest or gather to tell stories.  The wall surrounds this corner of the yard to the north and to the east.  You can make your way around the courtyard to the west and to the south.

extras.text: The bench is made of granite, polished smooth and into a shape perfect for sitting.  The grass around the bench is well worn from constant use.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: The courtyard stretches all directions here except the east, where the large stone wall stands providing shelter from the evils that threaten destruction of this holy settlement.  There are some stones in the wall that look odd and out of place, as if they have been moved.  You can make your way north, west and to the south.

extras.text: The stones seem to have been pulled from the wall, and rest loosely in their holes.  You might be able to move some of the stones.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You stand in the center of the courtyard, which seems to be the busiest part of the yard.  There are portions of the grass that have been worn into paths from the repeated travel of the townspeople.  To the west, you can see a little well standing alone, not being used at all.  To the south you see the mansion, which almost sits upon more ground than the courtyard does.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: A small stone well stands in the middle of some worn paths that cross in the grass.  You see a few townspeople taking water, but only in small amounts. There are small flowers that grow next to the well adding to the serene beauty of the courtyard.  You can continue onward through the courtyard in all directions.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: In this corner of the courtyard the air is still, due to the stone wall to the north and to the west.  The wall looks in much better shape from the inside, as if it is cleaned regularly.  There is a small plaque built into the wall, carved out of the same type of stone.  The courtyard continues on to the south and to the east.

extras.text: All that hold a holy value in their heart are welcome here.  Join us in our crusade to rid the land of the evil spirits that degrade others souls.  Make yourself at home and all we ask of you is your help.
The plaque is very elaborately carved from the same worn grey stone of the walls.  The words that are written on the plaque seem to be some sort of welcome sign.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: The courtyard ends here with the stone wall to the north.  The stone wall is decorated with small tapestries, depicting losses and victories in various battles.  There is a large red tapestry hanging in the middle that catches your eye.  You can see a simple built structure immediately to the west and another in the distance to the south.  You can also make your way to the east through the courtyard.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You are in the southwest corner of the courtyard, in front of a door leading to a structure to the south.  A worn trail leads south through the grass to the entrance door of the building.  You can hear what sounds like combat coming from inside the building.  You can make your way north or to the east through the courtyard, or into the building to the south.

South.description: There is a large wooden door, banded with huge flat iron pieces, with a large latch set back into the door.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: The thriving lawn of the courtyard stretches to the north, west and to the east.  A worn path runs parallel to the huge mansion to the south, creating a walkway from the door of the mansion to the door of the structure to the west. The mansion is constructed of what looks like a joining of the trees from the forest and the type of stone which is used in the surrounding wall.  You can see a window set in the stone of the mansion to the south, which you may be able to look into.

extras.text: The glass in the window is etched in a way that makes seeing into it almost impossible.  You can only see shadows of the shapes that are in the room, and some of the shadows seem to be moving about.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You are directly in front of the immense mansion to the south.  The structure of the mansion is extremely basic, but it almost takes on the shape of a castle.  Made from stone and wood, the exterior walls appear to be impenetrable.  To the south looks like the only entrance, a simple door made of solid wood, banded with large plates of steel.  You can travel north, west and to the east, through the courtyard.

South.description: The simple door is made of a dark colored solid wood, banded with a steel. You can see all sorts of battle scares, claw marks, sword incisions and hammer indentions.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You stand of the lush grass in the southeast corner of the courtyard.  To the east the stone wall unites with the edge of the large mansion, which looms to the south taking up the remaining space within the stone walls south of the courtyard.  You see a window on the mansion wall to the south, which you might be able to peek into.  You can venture west towards the door of the mansion or north through the courtyard.

extras.text: You can see into what looks like the dining room of the mansion.  There is a table set up in the middle of the room with many chairs surrounding it.  The walls look to be covered with banners and paintings, which you cannot see clear enough to determine what they depict.

rooms.name: Training Hall
rooms.description: This is what appears to be the training hall for all the Paladins, Holyguard and warriors that live in the Sacred Haven.  The floor is covered with a mixture of dirt and wood shavings, which look as if to be soaked in blood. The walls are built of stone, which are also stained with dried blood.  A musty stench of sweat permeates through the hall.  To the north is a door and the hall continues to the west and to the south.

North.description: There is a large wooden door, banded with huge flat iron pieces.  There are many scratches, dents and sword marks that cover the door.

rooms.name: Training Hall
rooms.description: It looks as if fierce battles have taken place here.  The wall reveals damage by weapons, the floor is in shambles and a few weapons lie about.  With this type of training the warriors from the Sacred Haven are a force not to be reckoned with.  A large mural takes up most of the wall here, although the bottom half is worn away from the fighting.  You can travel to the west, south or to the east, into the rest of the training hall.

extras.text: The top half of the mural is very intricately painted, with vivid colors and small details in every scene.  You can make out what seems to be a battle between humans and creatures.  There is a different scene on the bottom of the mural, which you can only see the very top part, and it looks to be of some people all gathered around something and you cannot quite make out what it is.

rooms.name: Training Hall
rooms.description: A large statue stands in the northwest corner, situated against the wall, standing tall and looking down almost like its watching you.  The dirt floor and stone wall is in good condition because the majority of the fighting takes place in the center of the hall.  You can make your way south or to the west through the training hall.

extras.text: A marble carved statue of a greater leader stands about fifteen feet tall. Clad in armor and sword in hand, he looks to have been a fierce opponent.  His eyes look almost life like and seem to follow your movements as you pass beside it.  There is a dedication carved on a marble plaque on the base of the statue.
To our beloved and fallen brother go our &1&bhearts&0 and our &6souls&0. We miss your presence and we long for the day to see you again.  Our lives shall not be the same with your absence.

rooms.name: Training Hall
rooms.description: A few mangled corpses, rotting and putrid, lay in a heap in the corner. They are composed of several sorts of beast, all hacked and bloody, and left there to be disposed of.  This is what happens to the training entities after their purpose is served.  This seems to be the source of all the blood shed within the training hall.  You can make your way north or to the east, through the hall.

rooms.name: Training Hall
rooms.description: The sights and smells of the training hall here are overwhelming.  There are layers of blood caked into the floor, some dried while some is still fresh. To the south there is an arch that leads into a smaller room, which looks to be the central part of this training hall.  You can travel through the hall to the west, north and the east.  You can enter the room through the arch to the south.

rooms.name: Training Hall
rooms.description: You are in the southwest corner of the training hall.  A few weapon racks line the wall, as well as racks containing shields, helms and other assorted armor.  The floor here is also well used, spattered and stained with blood.  A large tattered and torn banner hangs from the wall to the south.  You can make your way north and to the west, inside the training hall.

extras.text: The banner looks very old, and has many tears and rips throughout its length.  It is dark red in color, with gold tassels that hang from the corners.  The words read: Fight for your faith.  Fight for your heart.  Fight for our brother and may your strong will avenge his death.

rooms.name: Trainer's Room
rooms.description: The floor transitions to stone where you enter the room from the training hall.  The space is lit by flickering candle sconces on the walls and the shadows dance on the weapons that are lined against the wall.  There are a few benches scattered about and the walls are lined with plaques, banners and paintings.  You can exit the room through the arch to the north.

rooms.name: Gathering Room
rooms.description: There are several rustic brass lanterns that rest on marble tables, which light up the room perfectly.  The room is modestly decorated, with only one tapestry that hangs on the wall.  There is space for about forty people to gather, and this appears to be the area that many ideas and decisions are made concerning the Sacred Haven.  There is an etched window to the north and the exit door to the south.

South.description: The once beautiful finish on the dark wood of the door has been worn off due to years of use.  There is an eyehole in the middle of the door, so the people inside can see who's knocking.

extras.text: You can barely see through the etched window making out what appears to be the courtyard outside.  You can see shapes moving around, but cannot tell what they are.

rooms.name: Entry Hall
rooms.description: The entry of this mansion is nothing like the simple exterior.  There are elaborate decorations hanging from the walls and the floor is made of the finest stone around.  There is a glow of light coming from a chandelier suspended from the ceiling, which gives all the murals and banners a soft glow. You can travel north outside to the courtyard or you can head south down the hallway.

North.description: The simple door is made of a dark colored solid wood, banded with a steel. The wood around the door handle is worn down, from years of use.

rooms.name: Formal Dining Room
rooms.description: The greater part of this space is taken up by the elongated table that runs the length of the area.  The table is made of a dark, solid wood, flawlessly carved and inlaid with pearl designs.  There are paintings that cover the walls, depicting numerous battles, landscapes and portraits from the past. There is a large banner on the west wall that stretches out over several golden hooks, adorning the wall with vivid color.  There is a window on the north wall letting in views from the courtyard.  You can make your way south into the hallway or to the east, through a set of swinging doors.

East.description: A set of thin wooden swinging doors keep the smoke from the kitchen out of this room.  You notice a couple of silver springs that are loaded into the hinges.

extras.text: You can see into the courtyard through the window.  There are a few people walking around and some people sitting next to the stone wall.  The window is large enough to let in plenty of light during the day, giving ample radiance to light the entire room.

rooms.name: Sacred Haven's Kitchen
rooms.description: As you glance around the kitchen you catch the scent of food, although there is nothing cooking.  The smell seems to have permeated into the masonry of the stone walls, holding it there for all to enjoy.  There is a large, frequently used wooden butcher's block in the middle of the room.  A block oven stands to the south and a few racks hang from the ceiling holding an assortment of pots and pans.  You can make your way to the west through the swinging doors.

West.description: The thin set of wooden doors are stained with smoke and smeared with grease. All the hinges will stay rust free from all the oil that the kitchen deposits on them.

rooms.name: Social Chambers
rooms.description: The room is well lit with iridescent sconces that create a dull luster in the stone on the walls and the floor.  In the middle of the floor lies a red and blue rug, with chairs set up so that they surround it.  You see a few small tables set up in the corners of the room, each with a board game setup on them. There are numerous paintings hung on the wall, mostly of landscapes from around the realm.  You can exit this room to the west through the doorway.

West.description: The iron door is brownish in color from the rust that has been allowed to form.  The black iron banding is kept in top shape so that the structure of the door is not diminished.

extras.text: This seems to be a complex game with twelve handmade wooden pieces, six of which are &1&bred&0 and six which are &7silver&0.  The board is divided so that twenty small squares surround four large spaces, half the squares are &3&bgold&0 and half are &4&bblue&0.

rooms.name: Hallway
rooms.description: The hallway is decorated with extensive banners that flow and drape down the stone walls to the floor.  Some of the banners look like they are old battle flags, as they are discolored with blood and soil.  Some of them bear the mark of the Sacred Haven, while others are written in different languages.  You can verge on to the north through a large archway, east into a small doorway or west down the hallway.

East.description: The small iron door is covered with rust, but has been cleaned to give it an brownish color.  The door remains very sturdy, and the iron hinges have been kept in very good shape.

extras.text: The mark is embroidered in gold and is so finely sewn that it almost looks painted.  The mark is the letters SH within a circle, which is crossed by two might looking broadswords.  A few leaves hang off of the swords handles and look to be some sort of ivy.  The whole circle is then centered in a shield which is sewn with silver thread.

rooms.name: Hallway
rooms.description: The hallway splits off into different directions here.  The walls are lined with aged paintings of battle scenes and portraits of people old and young. There is a plush, red and brown carpet that is spread out on the floor down the hallway to the west.  You can make your way down each hallway to the north, west, south and to the east.

rooms.name: Hallway
rooms.description: The hallway comes to an end here, with a wall covered with a giant mural to the west.  The red and brown carpet is well worn, and shows signs of unraveling at the edges.  Old wooden doors stand to the north and to the south, or you can travel down the hallway to the east.

North.description: Years of use have worn this once grand door down to almost bare wood. There is a thin gold banding around the wooden latches, and a eyehole is positioned in the middle of the door.

South.description: The dark wooden door is well worn around the golden handle that is carved into the middle of the wood.  The gold banding around the edge of the door is starting to peel away and is in need of repair.

extras.text: The giant mural is very vividly painted with an assortment of colors.  The scene appears to be taking place in a small village of log houses.  The main part of the picture shows a young father playing with three of his sons.  The father looks to be in top physical condition as if he were a warrior of some sort.  The sons are all laughing and are having a great time with their father.

rooms.name: Gathering Room
rooms.description: You can smell the burnt ambers from the fireplace that sits in the corner of the room.  There are benches made with timber legs and posh fabric cushions positioned against the walls, set up to allow for the leisure and downtime of the Sacred Haven inhabitants.  You can exit the room to the north through a wooden door.

North.description: The dark wooden door is worn from years of use, as you can tell by the golden banding that is falling off.  A few cracks have formed from the heat of the fireplace.

rooms.name: Guard's Station
rooms.description: The hallway comes to an end at an open archway to the south.  The walls comprise of no decorations and the area is lit by a few shimmering sconces, which protrude from the stone.  There are two stone effigies that stand at attention on the west and the east side of the room.  You can make your way into the hallway to the north or travel south through the archway.

extras.text: The stones depict warriors who stand at guard.  They are about the size of a human and are wearing full sets of armor, with large swords at their sides. Lucky for you they are only made of stone.

rooms.name: Stairwell
rooms.description: The shadows cast from a single candle, situated in a niche in the wall, waver on the wooden beams and steps of the stairwell.  The dim light throws darkness into the corners of the walls, and a musty smell rises from the stairs leading down.  You seem to see something moving in the obscurity of the shadows, but it could just be your imagination.  You can climb the stairs up or down from here, or travel north into the hallway.

rooms.name: Stairwell
rooms.description: You are at the top of a set of wooden stairs, where light escapes from an archway leading to the north, into a well illuminated hallway.  There is a small candle-lit fixture hanging from above that only scarcely lights the stairs.  The peculiar method by which the stairs are attached to the stone walls create shadows that flicker and alter, causing the joints in the stone walls to appear to be slithering in place.  You can enter the archway to the north or you can descend into the stairway.

rooms.name: Sacred Haven's Armory
rooms.description: The smooth walls built in the circular shaped room catch your eye, being that this area has been created differently than most of the other stone walls in the mansion.  The walls appear to absorb any sounds you make, which mean they must be built thick.  There are large weapon racks constructed of cast iron, which line the base of the walls.  A handful of candles sit on a table in the middle of the room, lighting the weapons with a strange glow.  You can exit the room through the doors to the east.

East.description: A set of broad steel doors shimmer in the light, banded together with thick metal plates.  A large latch is located in the middle of the doors where they join together.

extras.text: The candles burn with a slow intensity, the wax cascading down their sides like a molten river, forming puddles at the base of each and bonding them together and to the table.  There are four total candles, each a different size and color.  The largest one is a dull &1red&0 color, next is a &3tan&0 one, then a smaller &4&bblue&0 one and the smallest is &2green&0 in color.

The racks hold many types of weapons.  There seems to be an abundance of swords and shields, a few looking unused but most seem to be well worn.  They all have been cleaned, and look like they are well kept after.

rooms.name: Guard's Station
rooms.description: The hallway comes to an end to the west, leading into a set of broad steel doors.  There are several half height walls jutting out of each side of the main stone walls in front of the doors, providing a superior stronghold for a guard to defend the door.  The room is well lit with numerous candle sconces hanging from the walls and the blue and silver rug is clearly worn and dirty, from many years of foot traffic.  You can travel down the hallway to the east or into the doors to the west.

West.description: A set of broad steel doors shimmer in the light, banded together with thick metal plates.  A large keyhole is located in the middle of the doors where they join together.

rooms.name: Golden Hallway
rooms.description: Ornate, golden tapestries drape the walls of this section of hallway.  Some illustrate scenes of fierce battle while others are more tranquil, embroidered with landscapes of beautiful regions within the realm.  A woven rug of blue and silver covers the stone floor, stretching down the hallways in three directions.  You can follow the hallway to the west, north or to the east. You can also enter an archway to the south.

extras.text: This is the battle that sealed our fate in the beginning of our village, bringing us to what we have become today.  As the battle endured, many great men were lost, causing a great deal of heartache and pain.  The leader of the village, a great Paladin named Thoaver, along with his three sons, lead the defense of the village from the evil horde.

This is the largest of the tapestries that hang on the walls.  It is embroidered with such expertise that it appears to be painted.  The scene shows a raging clash between a small group of men, consisting of common villagers and fierce Paladins, and a band of beasts of all color and form.  The beasts look as if they are overrunning the men, many of which are lying on the ground, wounded or dead.  There is some writing on the lower part of the tapestry, which seems to describe what is going on in the depiction.

rooms.name: Golden Hallway
rooms.description: The hallway comes to an end, with a basic door to the east and an intricately carved door to the north.  There are tapestries and banners that hang from all the walls, covering most of the stone.  The rug has a small worn out path in it that leads to the elaborate door.  You can enter either of the doors, or you can travel down the hallway to the west.

North.description: The dark wooden door is intricately carved from the highest quality wood around.  You can make out every detail of the flowers, birds, people, animals and other items that are included into the artwork.

East.description: A small wooden door banded with silver lining and lettered with a small plaque that reads 'Town Manager' is set into the grey stone walls.

rooms.name: Town Overseer's Office
rooms.description: The room is very small and cramped compared to the rest of the mansion.  A small desk sits in the corner with papers and books stacked high upon it.  A bookshelf lines the entire south wall, with all types of books.  A window is built into the east wall.  The only exit is through the door to the west.

West.description: The small wooden door is banded with silver lining, which is starting to tarnish a little bit.  There is a calendar that hangs in the center of the door.

extras.text: As you peer out the window, you can see the east side of the Sacred Havens guard wall.  You can also look out over the tree tops of the forest that stretches as far as the eye can see.

The bookshelf is crammed with all sorts of books, ranging from very large fat ones to small skinny ones.  Some of the books are written in unknown languages and several are composed about magic.  The majority of the books are written about fighting and war strategies.

rooms.name: High Priest Sanctuary
rooms.description: The walls catch your attention, because they are unlike any others in the mansion.  They have been built from a dark wood and sanded smooth to the touch. There is a simple desk on the wall to the west, with three books stacked neatly on top of it.  A small bench for kneeling or sitting is located directly in front of a window to the east.  An incense burner is letting off smoke from the corner of the room.  You can exit through the door to the north.

North.description: The small metal door reflects any light that happens to fall upon it.  It is very simple and almost blends in with the grey stones that surround it.

rooms.name: Holy Worship Area
rooms.description: There is a velvet red rug that covers most of the floor, stretching wall to wall.  A lot of small benches are spread out over the rug, allowing for people to sit or kneel at them.  There are no decorations on any part of the walls, leaving them bare.  You can see some smoke rising out of a few incense burners located in the corners of the room.  You can exit the worship area through the door to the south, or you can travel north into the rest of the room.

South.description: The intricately carved door glistens in the light from the candles.  You can make out many everyday objects such as fish, trees, clouds and streams, just to name a few.

extras.text: Almost &7&bpure white&0 &7smoke&0 rises from a &3&bgolden&0 pot, forged with small holes and crevices in the sides.  The pot looks to be well used, as the incense is burned constantly.

rooms.name: Golden Hallway
rooms.description: The stone walls of the hallway are scarcely visible behind all the banners and tapestries that are mounted to them.  There is a large tapestry that hangs in the center of the east wall, portraying what looks to be the aftermath of a battle.  There is a grand wooden door to the west, which is intricately carved with an emblem of broadswords and shields.  You can make your way north and south through the hallway.

West.description: The dark black, heavy wooden door is intricately carved with emblems of broadswords and shields.  The gold trim that circles the edges shine with a glow that showcases the wood of the door.

extras.text: This artwork appears to be woven to mourn the loss of the dead after a vicious battle.  The scene displays a group of men, all trampled and sullied from a defeat in battle, trying to regroup and help their fallen brethren. The village from which the battle was held is ransacked and ruined, with many people lying around on the ground.  There is some lettering on the bottom of the tapestry.

The consequences of this battle have been enormous, bringing two souls together by separating three.  After collecting their thoughts, Thoaver and two of his sons, Belward and Cyrus, search for their remaining brother, who appears to have gone missing.

rooms.name: Master Paladin's Office
rooms.description: Large suits of armor flank the four corners of the room, as if to guard the area.  The stone walls are dark and covered in shadows for the light in the office is coming from a set of candles, which most are burnt out and melted, that sit on a holder next to a desk.  There is a weapon rack behind the desk, with some brilliant looking swords resting in it.  A large wooden door is located in the wall to the west.

East.description: The dark black, heavy wooden door is trimmed in gold and silver.  The hinges are also made of gold, and a small black metal latch is built into the wood, to hold the door closed.

West.description: The large wooden door is built from a dark colored wood and looks to be very dense.  The golden banding that wraps the outside edge of the door is very tarnished and in need of some cleaning.

rooms.name: Head Warrior's Storeroom
rooms.description: There is a smell of mildew that waifs through the air, coming from the stacks of boxes and chests that are piled around the room.  The whole wall to the west is covered with shelves that hold assorted jars, boxes, bags and small chests.  Most of the items here are layered with dust and have not been used in a while.  You can exit the room through the doors to the east.

East.description: The dark wooden doors are latched together with a huge metal bar, holding anything from coming in.  It looks as if the room was locked from the inside, as the metal bar is set inside some supports into the wall.

rooms.name: Grand Staircase
rooms.description: The stairwell is very finely built, and well lit with golden candles, in holders mounted into the stone walls.  The stairwell has been created with no wood, only stones stacked and mortared together.  You can make your way up the stairwell or you can enter an archway to the east.

rooms.name: Golden Hallway
rooms.description: A large archway opens to the west, allowing for passage into it.  The hallway is well lighted by a few candle sconces mounted to the wall.  The splendor of the hallway continues to the south.  There are a couple of tapestries that hang on the walls, but a single large tapestry, bright red in color, is centered on the wall to the north.

extras.text: Thoaver realizes that his youngest son Drehbas is gone, and gathers together his remaining two sons, laying out a pack to rid the realms of evil.  They speak of a place where good souls can live and train for the purpose of eradicating evil.

The bright color of this tapestry holds your gaze, letting you take in all that is happening in the depiction.  An old man clad in armor and brandishing a broadsword, kneels in prayer with two younger men, who are dressed in the same armor.  All three men are bruised and bloody, as if they had just fought a battle.  There is some writing at the bottom of the tapestry.

rooms.name: Holy Worship Area
rooms.description: The rug is extremely worn in certain spots next to the benches around the room.  It looks as if patrons come back to the same place and position to pray everyday.  The room is lit by a candle chandelier that flickers constantly, sending dancing light onto the stone walls.  You see an altar to the east or the rest of the room to the south.

rooms.name: Altar
rooms.description: The altar is located in the back of the room to the east, centered in the stone wall.  The walls around the room are unadorned, and the stones seem to glow as the light reflects off them.  The altar is built of wood and stone, with gold trim decorating the edges.  You can continue west to the worship area or there is a small door located in the wall to the south.

South.description: A small metal door is set back into the grey stone wall.  It is very simply made and reflects the light because it is so well polished.

extras.text: May the holiness empower you to achieve all that is willed in your life

The carving is built out of a solid piece of dark wood, giving the picture a deep perception of depth.  The gold that surrounds the carving reflects light towards the picture, giving it additional intensity.  The carving is of a coat of arms with a giant shield in the middle, crossed by two broadswords.  There are some small flowers that hang from the swords handle and a banner draped across the top of the shield.  There are some words on the banner.

The altar looks to be simply made, with a stone base sitting on the floor. A wooden structure is built on top of the stones, creating a frame for a carving that rests in the middle.  Gold trim lines all the edges of the wood, giving the altar a splendid glow in the light.

rooms.name: Vault
rooms.description: There is a dim burning candle that is suspended from the ceiling, giving an eerie glow to everything in the room.  The stone walls are bare and have lots of mildew and dust collecting on them.  There are many chests and crates stacked along the walls, some open and overflowing while most are closed and locked.

North.description: The large door is built of stone and steel and banded with thick iron plates.  It is very dusty and looks to be seldom used.

rooms.name: Tribute to Drehbas
rooms.description: There is a bench set alongside the stone wall to the east, under a large window looking out over the forest.  There is a statue in the middle of the room carved of pure marble with dozens of small candles burning around its base.  There is a golden dragon about two feet long that sits in the corner with smoke billowing out of its nostrils.  You catch a whiff of the smoke and determine that it is incense.  There are two large vault doors to the north and west.  A huge steel door is located to the south.

North.description: The door is built with a very sturdy wood and banded together with thick iron and rusted bolts.  There are some iron bands that cross the door to reinforce it, so that it can't be broken down.

South.description: The large steel door massive and is banded with thick iron plates.  The majority of the door is built with grey stone, and it would be impossible to destroy.

West.description: The vault door is built of dark wood and banded together with silver metal. There is a giant lock that is set flush with the wood, and without the key you will not be opening it.

extras.text: The statue stands tall, clad in armor and displaying a figure that would be a worthy opponent in a fight.  His muscular build and daunting eyes could easily frighten any evil creature around.  As the light from the candles flicker it seems to put the statue in motion.  There is an inscription at the base of the great warrior.

Here stands our memory of a great friend, ally and brother.  Drehbas served his faith well and never wavered from the righteousness of his order.  May his soul look over us as we continue to smite evil in his name.

rooms.name: Belward's Room
rooms.description: The light in this room is almost blinding, reflecting off many golden vases that sit along the walls.  There is a large suit of armor that rests in the north-east corner of the room, looming over a small chair that sits in front of it.  A pale black weapon rack is positioned against the east wall, in front of a large window.  There is a large mural on the smooth wall to the north and a vault door built with heavy wood, inlayed with gems, to the south.

South.description: The vault door is built with a very sturdy wood, and banded together with thick iron and bolts.  There are a few gems, sparkling in the light, that are inlaid in the wood.

West.description: The large door is built of thick grained wood and banded with enormous plates of iron which are trimmed with gold.  Jewels of all colors and shapes are inlaid in the wood, creating what could be considered artwork.

extras.text: This mural is split up into different sections, each revealing a story. The first scene shows a group of people, surprised by an ambush in the forest, while they were traveling.  One warrior seems to be leading the fight to defend themselves.  The second picture shows the same group of people, setting up camp in a clearing in some dark woods.  The same warrior sits in front of everyone, giving a speech.  The third mural painting depicts a large stone wall that surrounds a mansion, being attacked by evil looking creatures from the woods. Very few of the creatures seem to have made their way over the wall.  The last picture shows a group of people, walking away from a grassy meadow with several gravestones set about, being lead by the same warrior from the other paintings. There is some writing at the top of the mural.

From the time of the battle that took my youngest brothers life, I have dedicated my life towards our idea of the Sacred Haven.  I have led this group of people into a great existence of laying down our will for the smiting of evil.  We have defended our haven from hoards of evil and I have led many operations into the realm to rid our lives of their ways.  As my father passed on I took on the responsibility to lead the Sacred Haven and keep it on task to eradicate evil.  -Belward

rooms.name: Guard's Station
rooms.description: The room opens out towards the east allowing for plenty of movement and from both the sides of the stone walls a low knee wall has been formed.  The knee walls almost meet in the middle of the room, with five feet between them.  The walls provide perfect cover for guards to stand behind.  A stone statue rests at the end of one of the stone walls, as if to guard the passage.  There is a grand arched door, covered with jewels and gold, to the east.  You can also leave the guards station to the west.

East.description: The large door is built of thick grained wood and banded with enormous plates of iron.  Jewels of all colors are inlaid in the wood and the plates of iron are trimmed with gold.

rooms.name: Cyrus's Room
rooms.description: There is a large desk against the south wall, stacked with books and papers. The light is provided by two candles, mounted into niches in the stone walls, that drip wax as if they were bleeding.  The wall to the north has been plastered smooth, and a giant mural is painted on it.  A large vault door, banded with steel and held shut by a massive lock, stands to the east.

East.description: The large vault door is built of dark, thick wood and banded together with a thick silver metal.  There are a few jewels inlaid in the wood, and the massive lock looks to be unbreakable.

West.description: A large arched door, built of sturdy wood, and banded together with black iron stands set back in the grey stones of the wall.  A few dents and scratches are apparent but the doors strength is intact.

extras.text: The mural seems to be split up into different scenes, depicting a different part of the story in each.  The first scene shows a group of men, women and children, all carrying packs and walking through a trail in the forest.  The second scene illustrates the people forming a small encampment in a clearing of a dark portion of woods.  The third section shows a great stone wall encircling a large mansion and some other buildings, giving them protection from what lurks in the forest.  In the last painting a group of people, some clad in armor and some in robes, burying a coffin made of pure gold.  The people weep and grieve for their loss.  There is a passage at the end of the mural.

After we formed a pack to purge evil from the realm, we moved to a location that we could prosper and form the idea we called Sacred Haven.  It was a small camp at first, but over time it became a great place for the gathering of Paladins and Priests, whose goodness and skills were spread to others in order to band together and eradicate evil.  As the years went by, our great father and leader, Thoaver took ill and passed away.  As the time goes on, my pain from the loss of my youngest brother grows deep, feeding the passion to protect all that is good.  My older brother Belward has stuck with me and been a great mentor, forming who I am today.  -Cyrus

rooms.name: Guard's Station
rooms.description: The light from the candles mounted on the stone walls flicker in front of a set of low knee walls, casting shadows that shift slowly against the floor. The low knee walls jut out from the main walls, closing in towards each other, leaving only about a five foot passage between them.  The large arched door to the east must be very important, given all the effort put forth to guard it. You can enter the staircase to the north, through an arched opening.

East.description: A large door is built of sturdy wood, banded together with jet black iron straps.  There are jewels that are inlaid in the wood and the grey stone of the wall fits tight with the door.

rooms.name: Grand Staircase
rooms.description: The staircase shifts into a large landing after the top step of the stairs. The landing is made from the same large, grey stones as the walls.  There is a round rug spread out over the floor, with an emblem embroidered into its center.  You can see large arched openings to the east and south or you can travel down the staircase.

extras.text: The emblem in the rug is gold and silver in color and seems to be very well made, for there is a lot of wear marks on the rug, but the emblem seems to be almost in perfect shape.  The emblem is the mark of the Sacred Haven, which is the same as on some of the banners you have seen elsewhere in the mansion.

rooms.name: Stairwell
rooms.description: The musty smell overwhelms your senses as you stand in the bottom of the stairwell.  A small candle lights the room with an unnatural glow that flickers off of the stone walls.  The room is filled with more dark than light, and the shadows in the corners make them look infinitely deep.  You can enter a small wooden doorway to the north or you can climb the stairs.

North.description: The wooden doorway is very damaged with scrapes and sword marks.  You can see a few cracks as well, but the integrity of the door stands strong.

rooms.name: Musty Hallway
rooms.description: The stones that line the walls of this hallway are covered with mildew and dust, giving the air a stale smell.  A few small candles litter the floor and give the hall little light.  Down the hall to the east you can see the radiance of light spilling out of a small archway.  You can enter the stairwell to the south.

South.description: The wooden doorway is built of a light colored wood, and is very dusty and dingy.

rooms.name: Lab Room
rooms.description: The majority of the room has been painted white and gleams with the light from the large candles in the corners.  The candles do their job and light the area very well.  There is a large table that sits in the middle of the room with several smaller ones lining the walls.  A shelf fills the wall to the south, holding numerous bottles, jars and vials of all shapes and colors.  A small door is located on the wall next to the corner to the east and an archway leads to the north.

East.description: A small wooden door is built into the grey stone of the walls.  There are no lock or handles, and it seems to be able to push open.

extras.text: The table is formed of shiny steel and is covered with many types of bottles, glass tubing, vials and Petri dishes.  Some of the jars hold liquid and others are set up to perform experiments on the various chemicals.  A large case holding vials is set up on the corner of the desk.

There are a few vials that catch your eye.  One is taller than the rest, filled with a &1&bred&0 liquid and has a label on it.  &5&b-Antidote-&0 Most of the vials are filled with a &4&bblue&0 liquid with labels attached.  &5&b-Convertor-&0

rooms.name: Chemical Storage Room
rooms.description: All the walls are covered with shelves leaving almost no room to walk around and giving what would be a large room an almost closet like size.  The walls are built of wood and are set halfway into the stone walls for more storage depth on the shelves.  There are thousands of jars, vials and containers that line them.  You can exit the storage room through the door to the west.

West.description: The small wooden door is built to be pushed open, with no locks or handles. It seems well used, as the wooden is well worn down.

rooms.name: Musty Hallway
rooms.description: The hallway runs west and south, with a doorway to the north.  The stone walls are very dingy and give off a strong smell of dirt.  The musty air seems to hardly move and the candles on the floor burn dimly as if they have already used up all the oxygen in the air.

North.description: The wooden door is stained blackish green from the mildew that grows on it. Hardly any wood can be seen except for around the door handle.

rooms.name: Scientist's Office
rooms.description: There is a desk that is located directly in front of the door, almost blocking it from opening fully.  There are some bookshelves on the wall to the north, holding many volumes of different sized books.  Alongside the other wall there is a small lab table, which holds a few vials and spiraling glass tubes set up for some type of experiment.  The table is loaded with numerous vials of assorted size, but one seems to stand out among the rest, set to the side.

South.description: The wooden door is very dingy, and is stained with different colors.  It looks like many chemical vials have been thrown and smashed into the wood in the door.

extras.text: The vial is twice the size of the others that rest on the table, and seems to be full of an unknown liquid.  Its cork stopper has been sealed with wax and the base of the vial is firmly attached to the table top.

rooms.name: Musty Hallway
rooms.description: The candles that lie scattered on the floors flicker dimly and cast deep shadows onto the pale green stones in the wall.  The mildew is so thick that it seems to be dripping off of the stones.  A few small chunks of stone have fallen out of the wall and sit pushed into the corner to the west.  The hallway continues to the east and to the north.

rooms.name: Guard's Station
rooms.description: The blackish-green stones in the wall absorb the light from the candles that burn on the small knee walls that jut from the main walls.  There is evidence of fighting in this guard's station, as some of the walls contain sword marks, broken stones and dried blood.  There is a small archway to the west and to hallway continues to the south.

rooms.name: Stairwell
rooms.description: A small set of wooden steps lead down into the darkness, as there are only a few large candles that are suspended from the ceiling above.  The light dances off the dark brown wooden beams that form the stairs and cast unnatural looking shadows along the walls.  You can descend the stairway or enter a small archway to the east.

rooms.name: Stairwell
rooms.description: The dingy smell of mildew that lingers in the air and the smoke from the small candle in the wall blend together to form a smell quite unlike anything you have encountered.  The light flickers off the wooden steps and only gives you enough illumination to barely see.  You can climb the stairs or head south down a small hallway.

rooms.name: Small Hallway
rooms.description: The musty smell that saturates the hall is almost overwhelming and the mildew color of the stones in the wall and the dust layered on them is evidence that this hall is hardly kept clean.  The floor shows lots of wear and is littered with small things that resemble flesh.  There are doors to the west and to the south, or the hallway continues to the east.

South.description: The small door is full of scratches and claw marks, and the wood is worn down where it has been repeatedly pushed open.

West.description: A small door rests build into the stone, blending in with the dark colors of the wall.

extras.text: Small pieces of dried flesh and bone are scattered about, some looking fresh while other pieces are smashed into the stone from foot traffic.  There is no evidence of blood and other than that the flesh things do not appear to be unusual, aside from being strewn all over the floor.

rooms.name: Disposal Room
rooms.description: Rank, putrid air sits stale in the murky room, lingering like the shadows that form in the corners.  The stone walls are only visible from about halfway up their height because of the piles that line the floors next to them.  You cannot tell what they are because the lighting is so dim, but you may be able to tell upon further investigation.  There are a few small tools that rest against the wall next to the door and the floor is composed of dirt, which seems to be caked together with dried blood.  There is only a small wooden doorway that leads to the east.

East.description: The small door is almost black with the amount of mildew that grows on the wood, almost hiding the door into the wall.

extras.text: As you look closely at the piles, you can tell that they are made from the flesh of creatures that have been long dead.  Some of the piles seem to be fresh and others have decomposed into a horrible mess.  Small beetles that number in the thousands consume the flesh, leaving just the bones lying on the floor.

All the tools are created from iron, with long dirty wooden handles.  They all resemble rakes of some sort.  Their only possible use would be to tend to the piles and constantly move and churn them to aid their decomposition.

rooms.name: Experiment Room
rooms.description: A few large metal tables are scattered around the room, all covered with tools, instruments and dried blood.  Lying on top of a couple of the tables are the bodies of some sort of humanoid creature.  There are numerous rusted shackles that dangle from the walls and a few shelves that hold various vials and jars of assorted liquids.  The floor is littered with dismembered parts of unknown creatures.  There is a small archway to the west and a door to the north.

North.description: The wooden door is scratched and dented, and covered with dried blood.  A small silver latch holds the door closed against the frame.

rooms.name: Conversion Room
rooms.description: There is a large, flat altar in the middle of the room, circled by statues and vases of dried flowers.  The altar is built of jet black granite and is sized to allow for a human-sized creature to lie on top of it.  A few incense burners bellow out white smoke which rises strait to the ceiling, creating a layer of haze.  A door is located to the east and a small corridor leads to the west.

extras.text: The top of the altar is formed of jet black granite with no color variation at all.  The base is also carved from black granite but contains streaks and veins of a metallic silver color, spreading out through the base like lightning.  The dried flowers look to be very old, as they have all lost their color.  The statues are of different warriors clad with armor, all posed to look like their guarding something.

rooms.name: Small Corridor
rooms.description: A small set of cracked wooden steps leads up and the corridor continues to the east.  The stone walls are arched in a way that gives you just enough room to squeeze by.  The floor is dirt and is very well worn, almost giving your steps the feeling of walking on dust.  There is very little light cast off by a candle on the floor, which gives you just enough light to see the dingy black stones in the wall.

rooms.name: Small Hallway
rooms.description: The hallway closes in towards the east as the walls and the ceiling leave less room for passage.  The stones that form the walls are mildew covered and are lined with dust.  The floor is layered with a dark colored dust and there is only a few footprints down the center of the hall.  You can continue down the hallway to the west or to the east.

rooms.name: Small Hallway
rooms.description: The small hallway comes to an end with a passage way to the north and a small steel door to the south.  Light flickers from the candles on the floor casting dancing shadows into the corners.  The stones in the wall around the door are giant compared to the rest.  A few broken swords litter the ground, lying in the corner almost out of view.

rooms.name: Treasure Keeper's Station
rooms.description: The stones in the wall are plated with a brilliant shining gold which reflects the light from the beautiful silver candle holder that sits in the middle of the room.  The floors are immaculate and seem to be made of the finest of the stones that could be found.  Two stone walls jut out from the main walls, forming some low guard walls in front of solid looking steel doors to the east and to the south.

East.description: The large silver steel door is banded with dark rusted iron plates, crossing the center of the door, creating a very strong barrier.

South.description: A giant steel door is securely bolted to the wall, banded together with black iron bands, that wrap and crisscross the door giving it superior strength.

rooms.name: Treasure Room
rooms.description: A dim candle burns casting shimmering light upon the old wooden chests that line the walls.  The stone in the walls are very large, as if to guard the secrets of this room.  There are piles of gold and silver trinkets, coins and other assorted valuables that lie in a heap next to the south wall.  Some shelves to the east hold various bags, sacks and containers, all of which look to be filled to the maximum.  You can exit this room through the door to the north.

North.description: The giant steel door is securely bolted to the wall, and the silver steel is very dusty and there are a few hand prints marring the door.

rooms.name: Treasure Room
rooms.description: The light wavers casting a monotonous flicker upon the dark grey stone walls in the room.  A few chests lie next to the wall to the east, gathering dust in thick layers.  The floor is formed of dirt, black and sticky to the touch, that holds your footprints and leaves tell tail signs of your presence.  The room is especially bare, except for the chests along the wall.  You can exit the room through the thick steel doors to the west.

West.description: The massive steel door is banded with rusted plates, that cross and form a superior barrier to keep out unwanted people.

rooms.name: Cell Guard's Station
rooms.description: The air in the room is very stale and reeks of mildew.  The blackish colored stones that make up the walls drip with moisture and give the room a dark existence, as the glow from the candles seem to be absorbed into the walls. There is a low knee wall that juts from both sides of the walls, coming together in the middle of the room allowing a small passage between them.  To the east there is a sturdy steel door, tarnished and rusted from the moisture. You can travel north into the rest of the guard's station or to the south through the small hallway.

East.description: The large steel door is tarnished and rusted, and the large iron hinges are formed into the wall.  A large lock is build into the steel which holds the door closed.

rooms.name: Cell
rooms.description: The cell is quite large with plenty of room to wander about.  The dark stones in the walls are extremely worn out from the scratching and clawing of the creatures imprisoned here.  A small pile of hay rests in the corner, giving a bed to those who are trapped here.  There is no light in the room, and the floor is a mixture of stone and dirt.  You can exit the room through the door to the west.

West.description: The large iron hinges are almost rusted shut, and the steel on the door is tarnished and very dingy.

rooms.name: Cell Guard's Station
rooms.description: The shadows cast from the light of the candles that burn on the floor create the illusion that the walls are pulsing with a life of their own.  The musty smell of the air overwhelms your senses as you breathe in the stale air.  To the north, the stone wall is covered with a tapestry that is hardly readable, due to the mildew growing on it.  There are rusty steel doors to the east and to the west, both of which are locked with a massive iron deadbolt located in the middle of the door.

East.description: The steel of the door is about fully rusted, but still is very strong.  A large deadbolt holds the door closed and locked.

West.description: The steel door is covered with rust and is starting to flake off and cover the floor.  A large deadbolt is fastened to the middle of the door, providing it with a locking mechanism.

extras.text: From what you can see of the artwork, as most of it is covered with mildew, it looks like about five warriors leading a group of chained creatures down a trail.  Where they are going is stained by the mildew and the person that is leading the effort is also covered from waist up.  There is another scene on the bottom of the tapestry, but the growth of the mildew prevents you from seeing what it could be about.

rooms.name: Cell
rooms.description: The smell in this room is horrible, caused by the dark black stones in the wall that are covered with mildew and are very damp.  There is a puddle of stagnant water that has collected next to the wall to the south, which also adds to the smell.  The floor is littered with bone and scraps of food, and hay is scattered all over the room.  There are some words scratched into the mildew in a large stone in the wall.  You can exit the cell through the door to the west.

North.description: A few stones can be moved to open up a passage way out of the cell.

West.description: The steel door is almost rusted shut, but still seems to be very sturdy despite all the rust.

extras.text: Blessed be those that follow thy faith Lessons see those that hollow thy hate From the darkness we will rise From the darkness we will shine Lead the holy unto the dark For revenge has scorned your heart We will surely bring an end And drown your life in your sin

rooms.name: Cell
rooms.description: The stones that make up the room are very clean, as if something has meticulously scraped off all the dirt and mildew that would normally inhabit them in this damp environment.  There is a small table and chair resting in the corner, with a small worn out bed along the west wall.  The floor is built of a grey stone, which is also very clean compared to what you would imagine a cell to be.  You can exit through the door to the east.

East.description: The steel door is flaking off rust and the iron hinges are almost corroded closed.

rooms.name: Hidden Tunnel
rooms.description: A small hand dug tunnel has been constructed in the dark brown dirt.  It is hardly large enough to walk in and you can see roots from the trees outside growing in the dirt.  A few wooden planks are positioned to hold up the ceiling, but you still feel dirt sporadically falling from above.  You can move a few stones and open the stone door to the south, or you can climb up the tunnel.

South.description: A few stones have been place to cover the opening, but seem to be placed so that they can't be opened from this side.

rooms.name: Small Corridor
rooms.description: The dark, wooden steps that fill the corridor lead up and down.  There is a trapdoor towards the top of the steps, built of thick wood and banded together with black bands of metal.  A single candle rests in a small alcove in the west wall, dripping wax in a stream down to the floor.  The light flickers quickly as the draft from the trapdoor pushes the flame into motion.

rooms.name: Hidden Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel levels off with a trapdoor leading up.  You can feel a cool draft blowing through the wooden planks of the trapdoor.  Spider webs crowd the walls and drape across the opening of the tunnel, some covered with dust as the tunnel has not been used for awhile.  It looks like the walls were dug out with small tools or maybe something's claws.  You can move down the tunnel or try and open the trapdoor above you.

Up.description: A small wooden trapdoor closes the entrance, with dirt and roots growing down between the cracks in the wood.

rooms.name: Bottom of the Trench
rooms.description: The trench has been dug out alongside the stone wall to the west to help defend the encampment.  The floor is dark colored dirt, littered with stones of various size and different types of bone.  A pile of debris lies to the south, preventing any passage further down the trench.  The walls are covered with claw marks, from creatures that must have been trying to escape.  You can try and climb up out of the trench the same way you came in, if you're lucky.

rooms.name: HOLDING ROOM
rooms.description: Room for sacred haven AI....and a basic spot to chill!

rooms.name: Well Worn Path
rooms.description: The worn path twists around some large trees and continues to the south, farther into the forest.  The underbrush is more prevalent as the trees seem to have been thinned out a bit, thus letting in more light.  A few green plants hang from the tree limbs, growing flowers that hang down towards the ground. You can just make out some sort of structure to the south, barely visible through the trees.

rooms.name: Well Worn Path
rooms.description: The path crosses next to a giant tree, with thick bark that is black as coal and peeling off in large chunks.  This is the heart of the woods, in the midst of trees that tower over head and a bare forest ground, with a few small vivid green plants sparsely growing from within the tree roots.  The path is littered with small stones, which have been packed into the dirt by foot travel.  The worn path leads off to the south and to the east.

rooms.name: Well Worn Path
rooms.description: The path widens out a bit, as the ground under the trees have lost any undergrowth due to lack of light.  The soil is black and rich with color, from assorted small flowering plants that thrive in the low light.  The path has been cleared out with small chunks of stone strewn down to help keep it clean. The path curves around a large tree to the west, and leads into the forest.

rooms.name: Well Worn Path
rooms.description: The undergrowth sprouting from the ground around the base of the trees almost closes in and covers the small path that leads deeper in to the forest to the south.  The path is used very often it appears, but with the crowding bushes it lies almost unseen.  The forest is darker to the south as the path leads away from the road, curving and meandering around the trees.

rooms.name: The Sacred Forge
rooms.description: The haven's private forge is a single building built between the outer wall and the courtyard.  The thick wooden walls are blackened with soot from the grey stone furnace set against the west wall.  An enormous anvil stands before the furnace, blackened from years of use.  Next to the anvil is a large water trough.  Holy symbols adorn the walls and furnace and a large permanent altar has been erected against the north wall.  You see numerous forging tools hanging from hooks on the walls and ceiling.

extras.text: A mighty two-headed hammer superimposed over an anvil, the holy symbol of Moradin, God of Dwarves, stands out chiefly among the many symbols decorating the forge.  The other symbols variously invoke the sacred act of Creation, bless craftspeople, protect the forge as particularly holy space, and more.

An idol of a stout dwarf resting his hands on the top of a two-headed hammer rests proudly atop the worked stop altar.  An inscription on it reads, "Moradin, All Father, in Your honor we Forge.  " Judging from the design and layout of the stonework, this set up merely a focal point because the entire forge is actually an altar.
